title: @Riot: "Lash" is a better term than "Slam" for Illaoi tentacles

replies.body:
_"I'm not big on sermons. Broken bones teach better lessons."_

Just because she's a 'teacher' doesn't mean the lesson isn't painful. Her teachings pack a wallop, and her animations follow suit, with all her actions and tentacle attacks being very forceful.

"Slam" describes most of Illaoi's gameplay accurately, actually.
That was pretty much our thinking. Lash had some good associations. Slam captured the raw strength and power vibe appropriate for Illaoi better though, versus the more whip like connotations of Lash.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cgAAiFBv,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2016-06-14T01:27:04.828+0000)
>
> That was pretty much our thinking. Lash had some good associations. Slam captured the raw strength and power vibe appropriate for Illaoi better though, versus the more whip like connotations of Lash.

Some additional perspective: 

In the literal gameplay sense, Illaoi targets a ground location with her tentacles, not an enemy. She is slamming the ground, not lashing it -- if her abilities were unit-targeted, lash may have been more appropriate. 

Also, punishment isn't Illaoi's goal. She teaches through brutal, mostly physical adversity. Penitence and punishment revolve around atonement, meaning that some grievance needs to be paid for. Illaoi doesn't care about mistakes, "sins" or even justice. Her instruction preaches strength and the rejection of stagnation or passivity.
But her E functions way more like a whip than a smashing/slam ability. She Indiana Jones the shit out of people. Would make a good skin, maybe more up Thresh's ally though.

One slam is not enough for a slam jam.

While Illaoi does make many references to teaching, she's a very straightforward and physical person, the tentacles and her put their full weight into every blow which sounds like a slam to me. A lash however is something that uses speed to maximize pain without much real damage beneath the surface (while Illaoi's tentacles actually slam through to the core of your soul)

> A lash however is something that uses speed to maximize pain without much real damage beneath the surface (while Illaoi's tentacles actually slam through to the core of your soul)

That's more dependent on the tool used. A simple whip or belt hurts a certain amount, but add spikes or something and make it a spiked whip like Romans had and it accomplishes a new function in digging deeper (literally). Illaoi's tentacles hurt deeper because they're a different tool for the same function: chastening.

> [{quoted}](name=UltimoMark3,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cgAAiFBv,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-13T19:45:06.570+0000)

A simple whip or belt hurts a certain amount, but add spikes or something and make it a spiked whip like Romans had and it accomplishes a new function in digging deeper (literally). Illaoi's tentacles hurt deeper because they're a different tool for the same function: chastening.

She doesn't punish with her tentacles, she challenges. She teaches by forcing you into a physical test.

And her tentacles lack any spikes or anything, they pretty clearly do all of their damage by simply impacting with a lot of raw force.

It's more of a test of spirit, meta-physical endurance, much like a spiritual dedication. Punishment comes because people don't follow the commands of her god, but she also tests them to see their dedication to life.
